one.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: used to mean someone or something of a type that has already been mentioned or is known about
one.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: ‘Have you got a camera?’ ‘No.’ ‘You should buy one (=buy a camera).'
The train was crowded so we decided to catch a later one  (=catch a later train).
The only jokes I tell are the ones that I hear from you.
I like all the pictures except this one.
one.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things
one.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The children seemed upset. One was crying.
She has two daughters. One is a primary school teacher, the other is a musician.
One of the girls I work with is getting married.
This is one of my favourite books.
one.translation[1].definitions[1].note_b: Although one of is followed by a plural noun, you use a singular verb
One of the windows was open
one.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: used to mean people in general, including yourself
one.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: One can never be too careful.
one.translation[1].definitions[2].note_b: In everyday English, people usually use you rather than one:
You can never be too careful.
one.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: used in particular phrases to mean ‘an alcoholic drink’
one.translation[1].definitions[3].note.t: (have) one for the road (=have one last alcoholic drink before you leave a place)
one.translation[1].definitions[3].exampl: How about a quick one at the pub?
one.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: used to emphasize a particular person or thing
one.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: One person I find very difficult is Bob.
If there’s one thing I can’t stand, it’s people who bite their nails.
one.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: used to talk about a particular person or thing in comparison with other similar people or things
one.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: Why does my card work in one cash machine and not in another?
one.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: used before the name of someone you do not know or have not heard of before
one.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: He was accused of stealing a horse from one Peter Wright.
one.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: Her one concern was to get to the door without being seen.
Claire is the one person I can trust.
one.translation[4].definitions[0].defini: a piece of paper money worth one dollar
